alert.note: Alert for Bland; Giles; Grayson; Pulaski; Smyth; Tazewell; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Pulaski, southwestern Giles, northeastern Smyth, northeastern Tazewell, Bland, Wythe, west central Carroll, northeastern Grayson and southwestern Mercer Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Northfork to near Suiter to Marion Wytheville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bluefield... Wytheville... Bland... Princeton... Rural Retreat... Matoaka... and Ceres. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
